snippet: Four people were killed and 16 were injured when a train struck a parade float carrying veterans in Midland, Tex.
abstract: Freight train collides with parade float carrying wounded veterans in Midland, Tex, killing four and injuring 16; National Transportation Safety Board begins investigation into what went wrong, and whether mechanical or human error is to blame.

byline.original: By MANNY FERNANDEZ and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS
byline.contributor: Manny Fernandez reported from Midland, and Emma G. Fitzsimmons from New York.

lead_paragraph: Four people were killed and 16 were injured when a train struck a parade float carrying veterans in Midland, Tex.

headline.seo: 4 Killed in Texas Train Crash Were Military Veterans
headline.main: Grief and Questions Abound After Fatal Parade Collision
headline.print_headline: Grief and Questions Abound After Fatal Parade Collision

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
